description: Easy Vegan Waffles! Crispy, Delicious, waffles for Everyday Breakfast. 1 Bowl. Serve with fruits and  favorite toppings. Vegan Waffle Recipe. Soy-free Nut-free option. Freezer friendly. Makes 3-4 regular size and 6-7 mini waffles

Easy Vegan Waffles! Crispy, Delicious, waffles for Everyday Breakfast. 1 Bowl, Freezer friendly. Serve with fruits and  favorite toppings. 
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2019/07/easy-vegan-waffles.html
Indian Kitchen Cookbook: https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-richas-indian-kitchen-cookbook
Everyday Kitchen Cookbook: https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-richas-everyday-kitchen

Sometimes you just need some good waffles to start the day! Simple everyday waffles that you can dress as you like. These easy waffles are a breeze to put together. They can also be adjusted to preferred crispyness and texture. I make a mix of flours and use that in the waffle recipe. You can play around with other flours of choice too.

A direct completely gluten-free substitution doesn’t work in the recipe, I’ll have a gluten-free version posted separately with a gf blend and the process that makes crispy non dry non crumbly waffles. In this recipe, you can replace a quarter of the flour with an alternate flour(with or without gluten flour).

recipeIngredient: 1 1/4 cup of my waffle mix (below) or   (all purpose flour + 2 tsp starch)
3 tbsp sugar (, fine cane sugar or coconut sugar or light brown)
1 1/4 cup non-dairy milk such as almond or soy or light coconut milk
1 tbsp oil (, plus more for cooking if needed)
a few drops almond extract ( or 1/4 tsp ground cinnamon)
1/3 cup wheat pastry flour  (or use more all purpose)
1 tbsp starch such as tapioca or cornstarch
2 tbsp almond flour (or use 1 tbsp rice flour for nut-free)

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk the flours under waffle mix. Add baking powder, salt, sugar and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, whisk the flours under waffle mix. Add baking powder, salt, sugar and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the oil and 1 cup + 2 tbsp non dairy milk and whisk well. Depending on the flours and non dairy milk used, you will need 1-2 tbsp more milk for a smooth batter. (You can add in chocolate chips or small blueberries in the batter at this time for variation)
recipeInstructions.name: Add the oil and 1 cup + 2 tbsp non dairy milk and whisk well. Depending on the flours and non dairy milk used, you will need 1-2 tbsp more milk for a smooth batter. (You can add in chocolate chips or small blueberries in the batter at this time for variation)

recipeInstructions.text: Let the batter sit for atleast 15 mins. (You can adjust the batter at this time if too thick, with additional non dairy milk, or a tbsp of flour if too thin)
recipeInstructions.name: Let the batter sit for atleast 15 mins. (You can adjust the batter at this time if too thick, with additional non dairy milk, or a tbsp of flour if too thin)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat your waffle maker. When hot, brush or spray oil if needed. Add the batter depending on the size of your waffle iron. (*Add a smaller portion of the batter, sprinkle some cinnamon sugar mix and add another tbsp or so batter on top for cinnamon swirl waffles)
recipeInstructions.name: Heat your waffle maker. When hot, brush or spray oil if needed. Add the batter depending on the size of your waffle iron. (*Add a smaller portion of the batter, sprinkle some cinnamon sugar mix and add another tbsp or so batter on top for cinnamon swirl waffles)

recipeInstructions.text: Cook until golden. The waffles will crisp more on cooling for a min or so. Remove the waffle and serve immediately or store in a warm oven (225 deg F) until ready to use. Serve with a drizzle of maple syrup, some vegan butter, fruits and other toppings and sides or choice. Store: Freeze the waffles once fully cooled in an airtight container. That for a few mins, then reheat in a toaster and serve.
